intro: Phyllanthus mittenianus, commonly known as the Mittenleaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble a mitten, hence its common name. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits, including anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
